edu.vt.cbil.visda.comp
Class DRMCore

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.cbil.visda.comp.DRMCore

public class DRMCore
extends java.lang.Object

The class performs a portfolio of discriminatory data projections for exploratory cluster visualization

Version:
visda_v0.1
Author:
Jiajing Wang

(package private)  java.lang.String[] projTypes
           
 double[][] top2Components
          the top TWO components for projection
 double[][] top2PCPPMVectors
          the top TWO components from PCA-PPM; the 2 PCA components with smallest kurtosis values are selected.
 double[][] top2PCVectors
          the top TWO components from PCA; the 2 PCA components with largest eigenvalues are selected.
 double[] Zjk
          the Posterior probabilities of all samples belong to current cluster, which are estimated at the upper level

          This Native (C++) function performs the Sub-Level PCA-PPM; At the sub-level, the covariance matrix of the cluster and the Posterior probabilities of samples estimated at the upper level are used to calculate the current level kurtosis.

               int p,
               int l,

Create a DRMCore instance

Parameters:
n - the number of samples
p - the number of genes
l - the index of current level
k - the index of sub-cluster at the current level
Method Detail

vePCA

public int vePCA(int n,
                 int p,
                 double[] data,
                 double[] pcavec_re,
                 double[] pcavec_im,
                 double[] pcaval_re,
                 double[] pcaval_im,
                 double[] pcadata_re,
                 double[] pcadata_im)
This Native (C++) function performs the Top-Level PCA(Principle Components Analysis)

Parameters:
n - the number of rows of matrix data
p - the number of columns of matrix data
data - the matrix data is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcavec_re - the real part of eigenvectors (in columns) is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcavec_im - the imaginary part of eigenvectors (in columns) is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcaval_re - the array containing the real part of eigenvalues
pcaval_im - the array containing the imaginary part of eigenvalues
pcadata_re - the real part of data projected onto the space defined by the PCA; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcadata_im - the imaginary part of data projected onto the space defined by the PCA; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
Returns:
'1'- successfully exit; '0'- exit with waring/error

veSubPCA

public int veSubPCA(int n,
                    int p,
                    double[] data,
                    double[] covData,
                    double[] pcavec_re,
                    double[] pcavec_im,
                    double[] pcaval_re,
                    double[] pcaval_im,
                    double[] pcadata_re,
                    double[] pcadata_im)
This Native (C++) function performs the Sub-Level PCA(Principle Components Analysis); At the sub-level, PCA for each cluster is performed using the covariance matrix of the cluster estimated at the upper level so that the PCA is probabilistic.

Parameters:
n - the number of rows of matrix data
p - the number of columns of matrix data
data - the matrix data is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
covData - the covariance matrix data, which is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcavec_re - the real part of eigenvectors (in columns) is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcavec_im - the imaginary part of eigenvectors (in columns) is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcaval_re - the array containing the real part of eigenvalues
pcaval_im - the array containing the imaginary part of eigenvalues
pcadata_re - the real part of data projected onto the space defined by the PCA; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcadata_im - the imaginary part of data projected onto the space defined by the PCA; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
Returns:
'1'- successfully exit; '0'- exit with waring/error

vePCAPPM

public int vePCAPPM(int n,
                    int p,
                    double[] pcadata,
                    double[] pcavec,
                    double[] pcappmvec)
This Native (C++) function performs the Top-Level PCA-PPM; Rank principal components resulted from PCA based on the kurtosis values of the data projection on the principal components. The kurtosis values are sorted by ascending order.

Parameters:
n - the number of rows of matrix data
p - the number of columns of matrix data
pcadata - the data projected onto the space defined by the PCA, which is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcavec - the eigenvectors (in columns) from PCA analysis, which is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcappmvec - the eigenvectors (in columns) from PCA-PPM analysis, which is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
Returns:
'1'- successfully exit; '0'- exit with waring/error

veSubPCAPPM

public int veSubPCAPPM(int n,
                       int p,
                       double[] pcadata_re,
                       double[] pcadata_im,
                       double[] pcavec_re,
                       double[] pcavec_im,
                       double[] pcaval_re,
                       double[] pcaval_im,
                       double[] Zjk,
                       double[] subpcappmvec_re,
                       double[] subpcappmvec_im)
This Native (C++) function performs the Sub-Level PCA-PPM; At the sub-level, the covariance matrix of the cluster and the Posterior probabilities of samples estimated at the upper level are used to calculate the current level kurtosis.

Parameters:
n - the number of rows of matrix data
p - the number of columns of matrix data
pcadata_re - the real part of data projected onto the space defined by the PCA; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcadata_im - the imaginary part of data projected onto the space defined by the PCA; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcavec_re - the real part of eigenvectors (in columns) from PCA is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcavec_im - the imaginary part of eigenvectors (in columns) from PCA is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
pcaval_re - the array containing the real part of eigenvalues
pcaval_im - the array containing the imaginary part of eigenvalues
Zjk - the Posterior probabilities of all samples belonging to the cluster at the upper level
subpcappmvec_re - the real part of eigenvectors (in columns) after kurtosis ranking; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
subpcappmvec_im - the imaginary part of eigenvectors (in columns) after kurtosis ranking; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
Returns:
'1'- successfully exit; '0'- exit with waring/error

veProjection

public void veProjection()
This method performs dimension reduction with PCA/PCAPPM method.

print

public void print()
This method prints the top 2 components from PCA/PCA-PPM
